summary: The term "parliamentary sitting" refers to a formal assembly of the European Parliament where members convene to deliberate on legislative proposals, scrutinize government actions, and engage in discussions pertinent to EU governance. These sittings are integral to the parliamentary proceedings, facilitating the democratic process within the EU framework. During a parliamentary sitting, various agenda items are addressed, including debates, voting on resolutions, and the examination of reports. The outcomes of these sittings significantly influence EU legislation and policy-making, underscoring the role of the Parliament in representing the interests of EU citizens and ensuring accountability within the Union's institutions.
